title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Decatur, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Originally scheduled to have a group panel interview but this was cancelled and rescheduled several times. I ended up interviewing with each person individually due to the schedule conflicts. Everyone seems quite tired and overworked. One person missed an interview because they were the only person working. Interview felt awkwardly formal and repetitive. No one seem like they wanted to be doing it.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: The process was smooth, it was virtually depending on who are interviewing with it was comfortable. Just making sure that you are your natural self is the most important thing.
Interview Questions: Why Im interested in the unit? What are my weakness

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview

Subsequently there was a virtual interview with departments that were looking to fill the position and then they will let you know if you were matched within 2 weeks. If not matched, you repeat the interview process.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty short interview lasting around 40 mins. It was not too bad and I was interviewed by 2 people. Mine was conducted online but could also be in person.

title: Volunteering Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Decatur, GA)

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: It was in a room with a couple different leadership and you met many awesome people depending on location. It was was to the point and fast. I enjoyed the process.
Interview Questions: What would you do in a certain situation?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: I had to meet a lot of people for this interview, but they were able to bundle some of the interviews together to avoid me constantly coming back in. Typical behavioral interview questions; very well coordinated where I needed to go.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your biggest accomplishment. How would you deal with something you didn't necessarily agree with?

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: After completing paperwork online, the RN Residency has two days of interviews where you can interview for up to three different units. The biggest problem is that there aren’t enough time slots so a lot of units fill up and you can’t interview for them! They’re also virtual, so there’s not much interaction and you don’t get to see the unit. Questions weren’t bad, but technology issues happened a lot and the only interviews were during the day so I had to leave class to do these interviews!
Interview Questions: Honestly I can’t remember any off the top of my head. This was a question I asked: “Why did you pick Emory”

title: Certified Diabetes Educator Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Got Contact from the recruiter and then had on-site interview for a week later But I didn’t get a result for three days And I don’t know when the results will be delivered the process was like comfortable and calming And then I felt They consider past experience my response and behavior from their past thing important

title: Patient Representative Interview

If you were approved at this process then you moved on to the next interview where you with the COO and another director and with 4 other candidates. title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview

The only people they hire or Africans Asians and white Americans but not black Americans.
Interview Questions: Where do you come from? Sadly when I reply to this question the only thing they were concerned about is finding out if I were foreign, because they want to make sure that they never hire black Americans.

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview

title: L&D Nurse Residency Interview

title: Medical Coder Interview

title: Data Analyst Interview

The follow-up interview was about 3 weeks after the initial and much more related to an environmental fit—the second interview left me with a sense that I was already being considered, not merely as a next step in an exhaustive process that may lead nowhere. Definitely more timely than other positions I applied for elsewhere.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my previous experience both directly and indirectly related to the position. They asked about my work ethic and style and the environments I thrive or shrink in.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: The interview was virtual. It was a panel interview with the Unit Director , clinical manager, and charge nurse. It was a seamless process. The interview was about 20 minutes long.

title: Medical Assistant Interview

title: Unit Clerk Interview

title: Emergency Department Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied for this position October 2022. I was finally contacted December 2021 to interview for an NP position at Emory Main and Midtown in the ED. On the day of the interview, we met at a busy Starbucks near a mall. There was a lot of conversation and commotion happening around us, so that was a bit distracting. The interview lasted 20 minutes. They mostly asked about why did I choose to apply to the Emergency Department (ED nurse for years) and what type of patients I like to care for as a nurse. Eventually, the two interviewers ran out of questions and started asking about random topics; many moments of silence occurred. I tried to make the interview interesting by asking questions, but by the end of the interview, it was clear that the interviewers lacked interest. They informed me that I should hear back from them after the holidays.  As I left, I saw that other interviewees had been sitting at a table next to where I was interviewing; I guess it was  interview day at Starbucks.   I never heard back from either interviewer. I assumed I did not get a job at either facility, but I confirmed as such when my application status online stated "No Longer Under Consideration" in March 2022. This interview experience left a lot to be desired; I doubt I'll apply for a job at Emory in the future.
Interview Questions:
Why did you choose the Emergency Department?
What are your favorite patients to care for as a nurse?
What hobbies do you have?
Would you be willing to consider additional schooling?

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: Moderate 3 panel interview. Asked to give examples of situations and how you handled the situation. Interview wasnt intimidating and was made to fee very comfortable. Interviewed with Director Manager and Supervisor.
Interview Questions: Name a time when  you

title: Clinical Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: Midtown, one interview with manager- very informal and nice.  But if background,  a personality  type and a clinical question.  Next a clinical test to screen for clinical skills.  Next a full interview with management and then staff.  Several situational questions to ask about clinical experiences. Everyone was very nice and positive. After a break, the  interview was cut short after the management portions due to their judgement that I did not have enough clinical experience. Not sure what the purpose of the test (I got all answers correct) and first interview were. Unprofessional.  Best to be a PGY2 I suppose and do not put weight on  the first screening interview and test.
Interview Questions:
Toughest patient/ clinical situation.
When you had to make a difficult decision.
A time when quality was compromised to get the job done.
A time when short staffed.

Interview questions:

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is extremely exaggerated and disjointed.  I initially interviewed with recruiter, followed by a soft land pre-screen with an administrator, followed by a zoom panel interview with 5 leadership team members of the department.  I was then scheduled for a zoom panel interview with providers, followed by a scheduled on site interview with leadership team and providers that lasted 5hrs. I was then scheduled for an additional interview with administrator again who asked if I could make time to visit the campus a second time to meet with a provider who was not available during the first visit.  As a candidate who was employed, this was extremely taxing to my time.  The company would benefit from streamlining the interview process.  I was ready to walk away after the 3rd interview as it set that tone that there were challenges with decision making, loop closing and time consideration within the department. If they cant value a candidates time they certainly wouldn't value staff time.  I did join the company and my observation was spot on.
Interview Questions: Typical situational, behavioral and technical leadership questions.  You will be asked the same questions(s) by 8-11 people.

title: Occupational Therapist Interview

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: I got the unit that I wanted for interview. They said it would be w/2 people, ended up with 5. One lady had her Zoom screen off and didn't really talk. The interview went well however changed at the end which I still dont understand why. I never got a follow up email after.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you were on a team, how have you experienced/worked with diversity? Why Emory, why nursing?

title: ICU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: Discussion of roles and responsibilities, expected orientation process, review of previous experience with selected patient population, and discussion of overall team dynamics within the unit.  Any excess time was spent on personal questions.
Interview Questions: Describing a normal shift with the selected patient population.

title: Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: I did an over the phone interview with two different people and there were situational questions given. You had to answer them in a way where you gave a specific event that you experienced.
Interview Questions: Name a situation in which you did not agree with a supervisor, how did you handle it and what was the outcome?

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Recruiter had called me to set up a interview. Talked to the department manager. Since it was COVID 19 I had interviewed over the phone. Asked me a lot of questions. Then was called the next day.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself? 
Tell me a difficult situation you have been in and how did you handle it?

title: RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: The interviews took place in a huge ballroom. They were only 30 minutes long. 50 other interviews were taking place at the same time, in the same room. It was almost impossible to sign up for an interview slot with the specialty units. Two leaders from each unit were at each table in the ballroom.
Interview Questions: Why nursing?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy process. They were very responsive to any of my questions or concerns. Questions during the interview were simple to understand and answer. Enjoyed speaking with them. good experience
Interview Questions: what made you choose nursing?

title: Patient Experience Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: It never happened. I was called to set up a phone interview and the day of I received a call saying there was an emergency with the interviewer. I was told it was uncertain of a day and time we could set up another phone interview. Days later, I wasn't under review any longer. Sad thing is, it's not the first time this happened. About 8 years ago, I was on the way to an interview and got a call that I wasn't scheduled. SO UNPROFESSIONAL!!!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Sterile Processing Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Asked regular interview questions. The person who interviewed me was nice especially since it was my first ever job interview! Asked a few questions about sterile processing and how it related to my experience.
Interview Questions: They asked basic interview questions.

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Followed by a phone interview with human resources. I was later called by the manager for an in-person interview. The  in person interview lasted approximately 30 minutes and was with the nurse managers and the nursing director of the unit.
Interview Questions: Describe a scenario where you showed leadership.

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a long-drawn-out process even with an employee referral. Alert, when it is not a huge hiring spree they don't pull applications. Get a referral from someone even if seems like begging just to get in the door.
Interview Questions: Express how you found the new job and why it's a good fit for you and your goals

title: Imaging Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Called for an interview, day and night manager gave interview. Then we walked around the area and took a tour of the department. They asked questions like job history and such.
Interview Questions: are you a team player?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: One on one with the hiring manager. Overall an average RN interview process with no surprises or inconvenience.  Hiring manager personable and experienced-knew on the spot if I was going to be a good fit with the culture/company.
Interview Questions: Are you flexable

title: PSC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Received a call about the position, setup up interview, did interview, received a call weeks later from office manager, and then recruiter called back about details and next steps until orientation
Interview Questions: Tell us why we should hire you

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard. APplied online, contacted for phone interview. then did on site. the whole process took a fews weeks. Very nice people No complaints. Easy questions. You'll do great if you just be yourself
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had a conflict with a supervisor?

title: Patient Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: Apply online and monitor the application process. Manager calls for a face to face interview. Than you will interview with the department directors. The manager will call back for the next steps.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Management Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was somewhat normal.  I had 2 one hour phone calls with two different people.  One was the hiring manager.  Both of them thought my qualifications might be a match and invited me to Atlanta to meet them in person along with the team, some clinicians, and a VP.  I was tired from my commute from California, but excited just the same because Atlanta had been one of the places I was looking to relocate to and was just so honored and happy to have been invited.  It was a full day and breakfast and lunch was included.  I was simply thrilled to be getting the chance to meet everyone and hear about their Lean Journey and the details of the role.  I believed I had much to contribute to the role and much to learn.  In addition, my conversations with most everyone I met were positive enough.   The following day one of my references called me to share that she had just received a phone call for a reference check.  I have often used this reference because we've known eachother professionally for some time and she has written a few of my performance evaluations since she was a previous boss of mine.  Anyway she called me because she was getting excited about the fact that I was getting a reference check from a healthcare system I admired and hoped to work for.  She even called me back (my reference) to share the example she used when we worked together.  My reference was as equally excited as me.  I mentioned to my other references to keep a look out should they get a call for a reference check.  A week went by and still nothing.  Another week and I finally decide to follow up with the hiring manager via email.  The response I got was, "since you left we have decided to focus on rethinking our recruitment strategy and are pursuing other candidates."  I asked for feedback about what it was that made them think I was no longer a good fit and heard nothing back.  I have no hard feelings, it was simply a lot of effort to fly out from Cali get prepared for my 8 hour interview, only to hear in an email that they are rethinking their recruitment strategy.  I would imagine a little bit more feedback after going through such a rigorous process.  I almost passed up a couple other opportunities because this one seemed so promising and a great opportunity to grow and be challenged even more within the breadth and scope of work that was specific to this role.
Interview Questions: Why Emory, What can you bring to this role?

title: Nuclear Medicine Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a lot more informal than I thought it would be. The two supervisors/managers I interviewed with had the greatest personalities. I can't recall a moment that a smile left their face and I can confidently say we laughed during the entire interview. I was shown around the department and met the rest of the techs. I didn't meet one unwelcoming person. This allowed me to break out of my shell and get through the interview as me and not a dressed up doll that the past 2 years of school has trained me to be. Absolutely amazing.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: ER Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very personable and engaging. My interviewers were also instrumental in me making choices for school that i could bridge from paramedicine to nursing. They focused on and was appreciative of my clinical knowledge and asked me why I chose to work in this field. They also gave me quite a few senario based questions that tested my level of critical thinking, common sense, emotional iq. Overall the interview didnt seem like an interrogation. Just a private get together with new friends that are interested in your future.
Interview Questions: What do you hope to gain from working in this field of work.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very disappointed with the entire interview process.  After seven months of calls, waiting, interviews, waiting, more interviews, more waiting... the recruiter called to discuss salary and references.  Weeks later, she finally calls to say they're going in a "different direction".  I hope they treat their patients better than they treat their candidates.

title: Coder II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was an okay process.  It was a total of two interviewers. One was the manager over revenue cycle and the other was the Lead coder for the position I applied for.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had conflict within the office and how did you handle it?

Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: applied online, got an interview, was interviewed but the director of the unit and charge nurse. They gave me a tour of the unit. I took about 30 mins. they asked specific questions to the unit.
Interview Questions:
why did you want to work here?
Give an example of how you provided excellent customer care
How did you deal with a pt with a different culture from you

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (New York, NY) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was a panel interview. STAR interview questions basically sceniero based questions. Word of advice be confident. Outline why your an asset to the company. Smile. Try to be relatable.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to deal with a difficult patient or customer? What was the situtation and what was the outcome.

title: Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions:
It was a smooth process. I could not make the initial date and was rescheduled for a new date quickly and smoothly. 
The interview lasted 1hr with a tour, questions and conversation
Interview Questions:
“What do you know about us? “
“We see here that you said ...... tell us more about that”
“Why did you choose this unit?”
“What are your career goals?”
“How confident are you in your skills? Especially IV” 
“Most challenging clinical experience”

title: Patient Access Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: They ask typical interview questions, the situation, how you handled it, and what was the outcome. Why should we chose you? They told me about the position and they made me feel comfortable.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Patient Access Representative I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: The process was pretty smooth it was a panel interview of 3, the process took pretty long though. My actual start date was about 1 month after interview. Once hired there is another month of training and then you are free to work. Depending on the department things can sometimes be hectic.
Interview Questions: What’s your plans for the future ?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Call with HR just to briefly go over your resume and your area of interest as well as desired shift. Then they send your info to hiring managers to units you are interested in. If they like it they call you back for interview. I got lucky and had a few like my resume but that meant three managers interviewing me at the same time. Was very intimidating but they were all very nice and non judgmental.  There was no skills test or IQ testing
Interview Questions:
Name a time you made a mistake and how did you fix it
How do you handle conflict with a patient or family member 
Why do you want to work here 
Tell me about yourself (first question)

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: Brief, the HR talked about what Emory does and asked me to introduce myself. I talked about my projects and she was asking questions related to what i have done in the project.
Interview Questions: Questioned from my Resume?

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview with mock questions. All staff in interview asked questions . Atmosphere was pleasant. Interview lasted about  15 to 20 min. Depending on questions and how long you take. Answer strictly to the point and what is asked of you.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 3 to 5 years?

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Getting an interview at Emory is a long process if you do not have any connections or employee referrals. I was contacted by recruiter a month after applying. Overall, the interview process is pretty average. Initial phone screen followed by panel interview a week later. Interview questions were the usual and pretty basic. I recommend being very personable in your interview. Practice your responses to interview questions but don't be a robot.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Emory?

title: Genetics Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Wonderful! Supervisors took candidate to dinner the night before, provided lodging and arranged a ride to the interview in the morning. Interviewed with physicians, lead operations coordinator, and the genetic counseling team. Went from 9am-3:30pm
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Leadership Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: The entire process needs to be revamped. You will apply for a position and can wait up to 180 to be contacted!!! That’s ridiculous and what does their talent acquisition do all day? On average it took a month to be contacted about the position I applied for.
Interview Questions: What’s your leadership style

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: Semi-loud room with multiple interviewing at the same time for various positions. It was internal interview day so a group of people from the floor met with you individually. Some specialties offered on the spot jobs. These jobs gave you 2 business days to accept or decline.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you had conflicting patient demands? how did you handle them? what was the result?

title: Accreditation Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: My interview was via Zoom and it began on time and the experience was wonderful.  My interviewer was nice she listened she asked me meaningful questions and made me feel very comfortable.
Interview Questions: What are your long-term goals?

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2018

Just be prepared and you should be fine. They asked about problem-solving and other strengths and answered my questions. They were very detailed about the position and process and everything went really well!

very long waiting time  . hard to get response from the HR. very long waiting time

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job on Indeed.com on a Friday, two days later (that Monday), I received an email to come for an interview the following Saturday.  I thought the interview was going to be one on one, however when I got to the interview it was a job fair. But it was not an open job fair where anyone could show up.  The unit I interviewed for only had one manager on the panel so I was not as anxious as I thought I would have been with 3 or 4  people to interview in front of.  My interview was about 30 minutes long. I was offered the position after the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time where you had to deal with a difficult patient and how did you handle the situation.

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I submitted the application on a Wednesday and recieved a phone call thursday for a phone interview. Scheduled the group interview at the end of the call. They asked me like 4 questions over the phone. Monday had the group interview and it was 2 other ladies was in there with me. The manager asked the same questions over the phone. At the end of the group interview, if you are selected for the final round, you will recieve an email today. 3 hours later, I recieved an email that I made it to the final round. My final interview was wednesday. Had to wear a suit. I was in the interview with another young lady and the manager asked 3 questions and gave us a breakdown of the job. I recieved an email the following monday with references and a background check.  Wednesday came and I recieved a phone call with an offer! Yay!!!
Interview Questions: Name a time were you had a mistake and had to fix it?

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Sandy Springs, Fulton, GA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online recieved a call couple weeks later. phone interview. in person interview a week later with a group.  then was called four days later with job offer. after that, through out training interviewed with multiple departments
Interview Questions: How do you handle a stressful situation

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very organized, wait only 15 min., very friendly and gave comfort, only two unit managers, asked questions that related my experiences. After that they asked me my preferred shift and offered me a job. They said they will call me an with offer next week.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, why Emory, what is your previous work experience

title: PACU RN (Main Campus) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview questions. Nothing different besides the standard "tell me about yourself." Emory does want applicants to be career driven & have goals. Good company to work for, and great benefits. Only drawback is parking in the University parking areas which requires shuttle to be taken to work (adds an extra 15-20 minutes).
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. What are your career goals.

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: First interview consisted of meeting with the department manager where target selection questions were asked.   At the second interview, I met the actual physicians and staff in the department and was interviewed individually by each physician in the department.
Interview Questions: State an example of a creative solution to unexpected situations when your leadership skills were needed.

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and got a phone call about two weeks later. It was a surprise call and I had a quick interview where I was asked questions such as "Why this position?", "What is a time you did something without guidance?", "Describe a difficult customer service experience.",  "What are your short and long-term goals?", "What is one positive and one negative thing your previous employer would say about you?", and "Describe your best customer service experience." I was scheduled for an in-person interview at the end of the phone interview. 

The in-person interview was a group interview with two other people and we were asked the same questions again. A week later, I got an email that I was chosen for a final round interview with executives from the company. I was called with an offer a few days later.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult customer service experience.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Decatur, GA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with Emory over the span of 2 months. 1st Interview with the Recruiter, 2nd Interview with the VP of the department, 3rd Interview with the reports of the VP 6 hours (including the person currently Acting in the Role), 4th interview with leaders of adjacent departments 6 hours.
Interview Questions: What is your process of evaluation? How do you create solutions? How do you coach? How is your current role aligned organizationally? How do you measure success?

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Very long, about 5 separate interviews with various people. It took a very long time to hear back from the hiring team. We met with the CFO which was pretty cool.
Interview Questions: Weaknesses

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview process, kind of intimidating at first but they are very nice and polite. You warm up pretty quickly after the first couple of questions but definitely prepare yourself beforehand!!
Interview Questions: What is a difficult policy you wanted to change and how did you handle it?

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Recieved a call on a late friday to come in on Monday for an interview and the in person interview was a group interview. I didn't like it but the questions were similar to what most have posted, such as why did you leave your job. How do you handle conflict. I never received a call or even a thanks but no thanks. I just wish companies would close out the loop for time we spend.
Interview Questions: Why Emory and Why this position

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very easy going and relaxing. Great energy for the individuals interviewing me. Lots of laughs and great conversation. Asked me briefly about my past drawing experiences, how I'd work with certain patients, and what skills I specifically possessed that made me a viable candidate for the job.
Interview Questions: My previous drawing experiences,  and how I'd handle certain situations with patients and & course-workers.

title: Patient Access Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Decatur, GA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. The process took about 1 month and some days. I went through 3 interviews.  First a phone interview then face to face then lastly  a group interview. Read up on the history and include the facts in your answers. Smile and dress professional. It's not a hard interview I just get really nervous. The phone interview was short to the point she asked mostly "describe a time when" questions. The face to face interview was a little more intense. I was given more questions and had to describe my work history as well as myself. The group interview was easy they explained it wasn't a competition. After the interview I received an email for 4 references. They won't make an offer until the references are completed. My interview process was quick I had a phone interview on Tuesday, The next day Wednesday I had my one on one interview then Thursday I had my group.  Then I received the job offer that following Tuesday.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Emory Healthcare?

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone screening interview out of nowhere which threw me off. Questions were rapid fire. After I had two group interviews. First group interview started really late. Interview questions were a repeated in final interview. I was called when offered to the position.
Interview Questions: Talk about a difficult customer service experience.

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: The campus held a job fair with antipation to staff the new hospital on Main Campus. I attended and did a one on one interview at which they would call you back if you were selected to move forward. I recieved an email within two weeks for a second department based interview at which time i attended. It was a group interview. They asked basice questions abouy experience, why emory, about past employers, situational based questions give me a tine when you........ Two weeks after the interview i was offered the position from hr.
Interview Questions: Give me a time you went above and beyond for a patient?

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: There were two in person interviews and they were both group interviews with four applicants at a time.  Before the in person interview some applicants who had phone interviews. You were given an extension in an email, and when you arrived at the location you had to call the interviewer to let her know you were there. They asked everyone the same questions and went down the line for answers. After the interview we were told we would receive an email that afternoon if they wanted us to come in for a second interview which was scheduled for two days later.
Interview Questions: Has there been a time where you had to implement a  policy that you didn't agree with  and how did you handle it?

title: Medical Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (New York, NY) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Interviewed three times for theposition, met with the office manager for the initial interview ,the clinical staff for the secondary and the chief physician for the third and final interview. 

Needless I swore to myself three interviews I had the position, however i never received an offer.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for the New Grad RN position and received an email about a week later saying that I was picked for an interview, but they only interview on one day. So you need to make sure you select the department and hospital you want as soon as you get the email. The interviews lasted about 30 minutes each (you can interview for a max of two departments). I received a phone call with an offer about a week and a half after the interview.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions: tell me about a situation where you could have prioritized your patients better, tell me about a time when you knew you made a difference whether in a clinical setting or volunteer or work experience, tell me why you want to work for Emory.

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The staff were welcoming. There were over 500 applicants, so they were running behind on interviews. Department managers were the ones conducting the interviews. Wish I could have scheduled with more than one department.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Emory Healthcare?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was done collectively by the director and other staff members with scenario type questions. Each person had a list of questions numbered from one to 10 and they took turns asking questions and jotting down my responses.
Interview Questions: What are my best attributes

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted by the TA Manager via phone and then she actually reached out to me via text since it was after hours. Set up a phone interview and thought the interview went very well but she obviously thought otherwise because I never heard from her again after several attempts to get a decision. It is unacceptable to personally reach out to a candidate and set up an interview with them and then not even do a standard decline. Being a seasoned Recruiter myself, I know all of us have time to decline every single candidate that applies and interviews.
Interview Questions: Standard questions; why are you looking, what are you looking for, what we are looking for, etc.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: was short and sweet just behavioral questions. I thought it would be harder especially since this is a healthcare environment but the people were really nice and down to earth.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses.

title: Patient Access Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone, Face to Face, Panel/group interview the phone interview was pretty easy, the face to face was easy still waiting to do the group/ panel interview with the CEO. You have to be prepared mainly on behavioral Questions dress for success and have a can do attitude.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Emory?

title: Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for the nurse residency program and received an invitation within 2 weeks. The interview process was held on a Saturday where all of the hiring managers at most of the units for all of the Atlanta Emory Hospitals held interviews all day for potential Nurse Residency Candidates. When you first arrive, you are ushered in to an auditorium/waiting area where one of the nurse managers speaks to you basically to kill the nerves/time while you wait to be called back for the actual interview. When called back, I was seated in front of 3 nurse unit managers for the Oncology floor and began the interview process. They were extremely warm and friendly and set you at ease to make you comfortable. They asked several questions regarding tough situations you may have faced, why you are a good candidate, previous work history, why nursing, why this floor, and asked about specific things from my resume. Once I was finished they gave me their card and asked for me to contact them about setting up a potential tour of the unit within the next week. Within a day I received an email with a preliminary offer from one of the managers saying he would have HR send an offer early next week and would like for me to come tour the unit soon. Overall a great process.
Interview Questions: Q: Why did you pick this unit?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: Overall, the interview process was in-depth and intense. Questions ranged from my experience to education. Most of the emphasis was placed on critical thinking and communication skills associated with high-performing healthcare consulting work. Questions were both behavioral and technical. There were a total of three interviews, with each lasting 60 minutes.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Access Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Decatur, GA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy going. I did a phone interview first, then a face to face. The final interview was a grouo interview with the VP. A week later I got my offer. They do send an email for 4 references and also a consent form for a background check.
Interview Questions: Name a time you solved a problem

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with 3-5 unit directors, they asked typical interview questions, what area of nursing are you interested in ? Clinical scenarios and how you would respond etc. Interview day was very organized. When scheduling your interview you can select up to 3 areas to interview with.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had to deal with a difficult patient or family member?

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: First: phone screen. Second: individual interview with two people, they ask similar questions to the phone screen be prepared to elaborate and possibly come up with better answers for those questions. Focus a lot on customer service. "Name a difficult customer you had to deal with" "Where have you had the best customer service" "What would your supervisor say you need to work on" "Name a time you saw something unethical and what you did". The second interview is the easiest part. Group interview but each have designated time to talk so you don't have to worry about out shining the others. There are always open positions as well so you are not each other's competition. Basically just reiterate the same things but also focus on "Why Emory, why now?" Focus on your experience and how it will contribute to Emory's mission and values. Ask your recruiter questions!!!! They will give you an offer without giving you any information at all and give you no time to decide.
Interview Questions: Why Emory?

title: Patient Access Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Decatur, GA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: 2 week 3 step interview process. I got a phone interview on Monday, a face to face interview today and I have an interview with the VP & Director next week. The young lady that interview me was very nice. It seems like the interview process  is well organized..
Interview Questions: How are you able to deal with an irrational patient on the phone and take another call immediately after without being irritated?

title: Registered Nurse Interview

When arrived I was walked over to my interview in a very friendly and organized manner.

title: Patient Service Coordinator Interview

The security guard is a bit over zealous, but for the most part everyone else is nice.  The interview process was brief and to the point.  I was asked a total of three questions.

title: Laboratory Technician Interview

I was interviewed by 2 people and was asked questions and given a chance to interview them as well. I went on a tour of the department and the lab manager was incredibly friendly and easy to talk to. I received an offer 8 days after my interview.
Interview Questions: I was asked basic questions on solving problems in the workplace, dealing with conflict, and long-term career goals

title: Patient Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. The process took about 2 weeks. I was sent an email for a phone interview. However, I did not get a call. A few days later I was emailed again to schedule another phone interview. It was pretty intense. The interviewer asked me questions back to back. I had to really think on my feet. A day later I was asked to come in for a second interview. The second interview was a lot more relaxed. I interviewed with the lady who interviewed me during my phone interview and the talent aquistision manager. It was more informational than a regular interview. Two days later I got an email from the talent aquistision manager asking to come in for a final interview. I interviewed with two other candidates. This time we would be interviewing with the VP of operations. This interview was pretty intense. However, I was well prepared and I was myself. On that Friday, I got a phone call offering me the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied over a month ago, got called on a Thursday for a interview on Wednesday and I live out of state. Got a bland email that gave me no information or direction on to how to get to hospital. Arrived 30 minutes before and had to wait a additional 30 minutes for my interview. Two black women preformed the interview one who was dressed very unprofessional (she had on flip flops). The interview question weren't hard at all. Received a call for a phone interview on a Sunday and guy told me him and the other two women were defiantly interested and I would receive a call from HR. HR called me days later telling me I was over qualified for the position, don't know how when it the exactly same thing I do at my current job lol. Just think they didn't want to top my current salary from what I've read they like to give their employees little to nothing.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you had to deal with a technical issues.

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview

They asked questions like "name a time..." so I just elaborated on the answers I had given to them over the phone. I did my interview August 3rd and still have not heard anything regarding whether or not I received the position.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had to tell someone no.

title: Medical Assistant Interview

Interview Questions: If you were given a tool box. What tool will you compare yourself to?

title: PSC I Interview

title: Pct Interview

title: Patient Access Associate Interview

3 Group interview in admin office for 30 minutes, two head executives went around and as several questions
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at emory?

title: Patient Access Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: You have three different interviews. Phone, one on one and then a group interview. The phone interview was to inform you of what the job is and determine if you are a good fit with a few  basic questions. The one on one was brief and more questions asked geared around customer care. The group panel showed how we worked as a team and gave the interviewers a to get to know your personality
Interview Questions: What does customer service mean to you

title: Patient Access Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online but had an employee referral so I got an email two days later saying it was forwarded to hiring manager for further review. I then got a phone call on Friday but missed the call since I was at work. A voicemail was left and a number attached saying to return the call to set up phone screening. After repeated attempts to call back almost 20 minutes after the initial call I never got an answer. My friend told me to be patient but almost a week went by. I called several more times and left voice mails so finally my friend went over to the lady and asked her what was up and she said I didn't answer the phone so she figured i had moved on? How am i suppose to schedule my life for an out of the blue phone call if she had paid close attention to my resume it showed that i was currently working two jobs and still technically enrolled in college so the likelihood of me not doing something is slim. Finally after 2 weeks from the initial call she called me back and asked a bunch of Why do you want to work here and what would you offer questions; it lasted maybe 7 minutes and then i was set up for an in person interview. I got there and it was very informal and I easily was passed along to the third interview which is a group interview. I feel like I had the most non rehearsed answers, one girl answered with the companies values and mission and almost sounded as if she was reading from a script and the rest of them said um after every word. I was sure I got the job but i got the generic email two days later telling me how competitive the process was. I have applied for other positions at Emory with the same qualifications such as patient services coordinator and somehow can't seem to get another interview. I will go out on a limb and say Emory is sexist and only hires women for the patient access department. I am glad I didn't get the job at this point and will never work for this organization.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you provided customer service?

title: Biomed Tech Interview

title: Patient Access Associate Interview

title: Patient Service Coordinator Interview

How did you handle a difficult customer or situation? 
Tell me about yourself...

title: Patient Account Representative Interview

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview

title: Patient Access Associate (Call Center) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Don't even waste your time! Emory Clinic has the worst interview process that I have ever seen and experienced. This healthcare organization leaves you completely in the dark about whether or not you will receive a job offer once you've interviewed with them. If you are seeking "anxiety" then this would be the right hospital you'd fit perfectly in with. 

You can give it your best shot at the interview with the President and COO, have the perfect background and meet all of the qualifications to perform the job, and still not get a job offer. This organization is mostly seeking people already in a management position. 

I can see why anyone wouldn't want to merge with this hospital. It all starts with leadership. The President and COO does not exhibit the type of characteristics from people being in charge. They do not look or appear to be confident in who they are. How can they expect the same from the rest of the team or from people interviewing for a job?

On top of that, the talent acquisition associates (HR Department) definitely does not fit the job description of people that are actually qualified to work in the office and select/choose the right candidates for Emory, because they are not the right candidates themselves. Emory Healthcare (Clinic) will have you interviewing over and over again for the same positions in which you already have before, just because they have different assigned requisition numbers with the same job title, as this has happened to me numerous of times before. On top of that the pay($13/hr - $14.51/hr) is very disappointing for people with a college degree education. I am definitely not applying with this company again! It's just not worth all of the hassle they put you through.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Emory? Why now?

title: Patient Access Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Decatur, GA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got a call from a recruiter in about 4 weeks, scheduled an interview, came in for the interview and by the way...it was very difficult to find and no visual sign (parking is crazy) which almost makes you not want to accept the job because of parking. Interview went well..but as a previous interviewee stated THIS IS A WASTE OF TIME. They toy with candidates' emotions! Yes, toy with like kids. They gather all these fantastic potential employees, interview with them, hire one to none. It's just an experience to them. It's a shame that such a "reputable" company has such "unreputable practices. This is a very young people type environment so maybe they don't know any better. Kids only hire who they know. Professional people GO ELSEWHERE where appreciated and you have a fair chance of actually getting hired!!!
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work for Emory?
Name a time when...
Mostly behavior questions.

title: Patient Access Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Three part interview, phone interview, meeting with Director of Patient Access, then meeting with Assistant director and CEO of Emory Clinic. They asked standard customer service based questions. If you make it to the second interview you will have to complete a typing test. The third interview is a group interview with 2-3 interviewers and 3-4 applicants.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you went above and beyond your job role.

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very general questions were asked during the interview process.  The interview was very relaxed and causal.  I went in after I submitted and application online and asked about interview.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Nurse Clinician (RN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online several days later I received a call from the recruitment office. They setup and interview and I can in the next day. Interviewed with 3 of the 5 floor managers for the hospital. I do want to say that there was confusion about the job I applied for. I applied for a specific floor but the recruiter had printed and stated a different unit. I brought this up but nothing was said. Anyways you interview with all the managers and who ever likes you or has a spot for you will over you a spot and you get to pick.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you had a patient that had an unexpected outcome. How did you handle this?

title: Patient Access Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Decatur, AL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied and got a phone interview the next day. Two days later I was called back to come in for a one on one interview the following Tuesday. It was difficult to find and I got there on time only because someone pointed me in the right direction after 20 minutes of looking! The woman interviewing me was very cold even after telling me how qualified I was! She never smiled and only asked me 3 questions completely unrelated to the job I was applying for. I knew I wouldn't get a call back when she said I should apply to other jobs in other healthcare places because I had more than enough experience. Everyone was nice but if I had to work under her I wouldn't do it. I never even got a call back saying if I was. Going on to the next phase. After a week and a half I knew my fate.
Interview Questions: How is the weather outside today? Do you have any questions for me?

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview

Then I flew to Atlanta for an interview with the manager and a surgeon, I also had a separate interview the same day with a Physician Assistant. They asked pretty standard questions nothing that threw me off, more workplace situation type questions and questions about myself/qualities.

title: Patient Account Representative Interview

title: Director Interview

title: Patient Access Associate Interview

title: Nurse Tech Agency Float Pool Interview

At first I hated this hospital because it was not as good as put say it is, but its starting to grow on me now that .I am starting to use the resources that the place offer.
Interview Questions: When was a time you had a difficult patient? how did you handle it ?

title: Patient Access Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Decatur, GA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was 45 minutes and the questions were basic. It was a group interview and could be a bit difficult because you don't want to have the same response to the same question. We were told by recruiters that there were plenty of spots available so there was no competition. At the end of the day the position was never filled.

title: Patient Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Decatur, GA)
Interview Descriptions:
So I applied online and I received a phone call within two weeks.  They scheduled an interview. First off, I was not impressed with professionalism that was exhibited! Upon arrival, I proceeded to park in the parking garage where I was told to park once I arrived(the area was hard to find).  10 minutes later I found it only for the parking attendant to tell me that the parking garage was full.  I then went to another parking garage.

Finally, seated in what I thought was the interview room I waited along with another young lady.  We waited in the conference room for 25 minutes(were looking at one another thinking what it really going on.  Finally, Caucasian recruiter comes down and gets us and apologizes for the parking issue.  Greeted by another recruiter African American, I sat down and the questioning begin.
Interview Questions: The questions weren't really hard but it was more so a meet and greet type thing. They asked general questions and really just wanted to get a fill for who you are. I will say the Caucasian gentlemen was very pleasant while the African American lady was very straightforward and not so nice; she came off kind of snobby.  During my interview, she says oh did I cover everything I'm not sure I've interviewed about 20 people. I thought that was not cool being that I was already nervous.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Decatur, GA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Director, clinical coordinator, and 2 charge nurses asked about 6 questions. Let me ask questions and took me on a tour of the unit. I was told immediately I would be offered a job and received an official offer via email from HR the same day.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you had a conflict with a co-worker and how to resolved it.

title: Medical Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Manager called on weekend, and said hundreds of resumes had been sent for this position. I applied and got a response for medical secretary a month later.  Interview was pretty informal and laid back. It included the Clinical manager and Director. It was in office.

title: Patient Service Manager Interview

Interview Descriptions: When I was hired it was under St. Joseph's Hospital of Atlanta.  Then I was interviewed by the Scheduling Supervisor,  I became the scheduling lead then interim Patient Acces Lead and finally the PAS Manager.  I was interviewed originally over the phone then in person.  Because of my experience I was hired right away.  The level of training was one on one with the supervisor, very thorough.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest pet peeve?

title: Patient Account Representative Interview

Interview Questions: Name one of the skills that you possess that'll help you in your role as a PAA?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory Healthcare
Interview Descriptions:
Cover Letter and Resume: Round 1
Pick top 3 project choices and write an essay on why you want those project choices: Round 2
Interview across the board with different section administrators: Round 3
Get an offer: Round 4
Interview Questions: If you had to work with another intern how would you manage them?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Relaxed environment. Behavioral questions were asked.  Questions not too difficult if you prepare. How did you handle a team member who was not performing well?  Discuss a difficult situation and how did you handle it?
Interview Questions: Have you ever went along with a policy even though you didn't agree with it?

title: Pharmacy Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and I received an email a week later saying that I was being considered for the position. A week later I was contact to schedule an interview. The interview consisted of two supervisors for the department. They read from a scripted paper and showed me around the lab and introduced me to some of the people I could possibly be working with. A few days after the interview I received an email saying that my information had been sent to the recruitment office and I was sent some "pre-employment" information. Two days later I was offered the job and sent more information about pre-employment requirements.
Interview Questions: The questions were very simple things about how you behave and handle certain situations. How do you handle things that are out of your control? Have you ever been a part of a team where someone isn't holding their own weight? Describe a time when you acted quickly? Describe a difficult situation and how you handled it?

title: Business Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online in June. There was a phone interview in July.  I was asked to come in for panel interview in August. There were the director, associate director, Sr Manager. They were looking for someone with a unique background.
Interview Questions: What is your definition of management and your definition of leadership?

title: Patient Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions:
This process began with a job fair that felt much like a cattle call. I had an initial interview that day (Thurs) which lasted about 30 min. The man who interviewed me was very pleasant and thorough in his questions. They stated I would hear back the following Tuesday- I did not hear back until Wed or Thurs and it was nerve-wracking! Thankfully they extended a 2nd interview to me and it was for the final group interview with the President. I will say, the group interview made me anxious because I had never done that before. There were 4 other interviewees who joined me in the process. There were 3 recruiters and the President who asked us a variety of questions. The challenging aspect of doing a group interview was with reference to answering the questions: For ex, a recruiter would ask a question and pick a random person to answer. They then may go clockwise, counter clockwise or switch up the order of who answered next. That means you have to be on your toes with answers and also be prepared with other answers in the event your answer was given by another interviewee. It was intimidating to say the least!  

I worked with two different recruiters. The male recruiter who followed up with me after the 2nd interview was professional and informative. Unfortunately, I was not as impressed with the other female recruiter who extended the offer letter and set up my original interview. She was curt, unhelpful, and borderline rude. She gave me a moment to pause when it came to accepting this position because she made me feel so unwelcome and uncomfortable. I found her attitude super unfortunate, especially for the role she is in as a recruiter where I would expect someone to be more customer service friendly and warm. Aside from her, everyone else I dealt with was lovely, professional, well spoken and kind!
Interview Questions: What is one undergrad class you would take again if you could? How would you summarize your resume in one line? Describe a quality/characteristic that a parent imparts to you that is the most important and how it relates to this role?

title: ER Patient Access Representative - Midtown Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was pretty easy. I applied online same day the job was posted and received a call from a recruiter the same day(Monday 6/23) inviting me to a interview for that Wednesday(6/25) I interviewed at midtown with the Admissions manager. She made me feel very comfortable, felt as if we already knew each other. The questions asked were behavioral questions and see how well I worked with a team. The interview only lasted about 30 mins. I was told that I would hear something by that Friday, if not call the following Monday to check my status with HR. I didn't  receive a call that Friday or Monday. Ugh! So I emailed Hr to check status she told me she hadn't receive any information about the interviews that were held and when she did she would follow up. About 2 weeks later (7/8/14)I received a call from her offering me the job. I then had to schedule a date for my hire health assessment which I took Tuesday 7/15. Now I am officially an Emory employee. My start date is 7/28.
Interview Questions: If your co worker had a problem with you, how would you address it?

title: Service Performance Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Several interviews including phone screening, panel interviews with leadership and current team members. Leadership needs to see professionalism and intelligence, team needs to know you'll be a good fit.
Interview Questions: How would you influence culture shift toward more patient-centric care.

title: Intern - Hourly Interview

The initial phone screen was with an Administrative Fellow, the second with the preceptor.
Interview Questions:
General interview questions: Why Emory? What makes you a good candidate? What are you future career goals? What do you expect to gain from this internship experience?

Just be knowledgeable about the organization ahead of time, have a strong resume/cover letter, and be able to recall why you initially applied for that position.

title: Patient Service Coordinator Interview

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview

title: Patient Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare
Interview Descriptions: Crazy&Long......Started with a job fair on a Saturday. Depending on how well you did it was three different interviews  If you did well they said they would call. It took about a week for them to call back, then I had to come in for a group interview with about four others. Sat with the President and another administration for about an hour, that felt like three
Interview Questions:
Super hard only because you have the answers and back up answers, but when you don't get asked first and others say what you have planned or something similar you really have to think really hard and breathe...

Who has influenced you the most?
Who do you think is influential?
How do  handle stress?
How do make each persons experience unique?
If you could go back to your last job what would you do differently?
What is considered a good day?
What are some strengths and weakness?
How would you describe yourself?

And countless others!!!!!!!!

how would you react in center situations with a patient?

title: Clinical Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare in Mar 2012

Interview Questions: N/A

title: Call Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Emory uses an interview technique called Targeted Selection, and you can find lots of study guides for how to answer those questions online.  They want a STAR answer:  Situation (Set up the scene or background of your example), Task/Target (what you were supposed to do in the situation), Action (what you actually did), and Result (how the situation was resolved BECAUSE OF YOUR ACTION.)  If you can touch all of those points in your answer, you're gold.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you led change in your workplace? What initiatives did you take to implement change? Was it successful?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was super easy! I met the recruiter at a job fair. She promised she was going to call me and never did. I had to hunt her down and call until she got sick of me. Once I got her on the phone, I was hooked up with the hiring manager for an interview.

title: Registered Nurse Interview

I declined to take the job, because it was a rotating shift job and I was not interested in that kind of job,
Interview Questions: Would you have a problem with seeing patients coming in bleeding, or having been in accidents, etc.?

title: Pharmacy Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory Healthcare (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: The whole process of getting through HR processing takes a long time. Very simple procedure; applied online, sent in a resume. I don't think they ever contacted my references. They require a background check also. I came in for a short interview, about 30 minutes, which consisted of a meeting with 2 supervisors. They ask you a series of basic, stereotypical interview questions that really have nothing to do with the position (they write down all of your answers while you are talking so it helps to have more than 10 seconds worth of stuff to say). I remember being asked about a time when I worked in a team where someone wasn't pulling his weight, greatest strengths/weaknesses, a time when something didn't go as planned. A lot of questions seemed very similar so I felt like I was using similar stories for a lot of the questions but it didn't really seem to matter. Then they showed me around the pharmacy and introduced me to a few staff members that were nearby. Everybody was nice and laid back.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time where you found a problem with a process and how you went about fixing it.
